summary: Navigation on hikes is no longer a problem. Download the map, put notes and go!
changelog:
• Added initial support for Android Auto
• User interface update for UTM coordinate search
• GPS Filter for GPX Tracks
• Elevation Widget (Pro)
• Favorites: added ability to view recently used icons
• Route planning: will use the selected profile after launch
• Fixed Mapillary layer, the plugin is now disabled by default
• Added screen to manage all history in the app
• Map orientation is not reset after restarting the app
• Improved SRTM height marker rendering
• Fixed Arabic map captions

reviews.review: Fantastic application
I download the mod 🙂 free of cost 🙂
Great offline map

is a very good and useful application. the only downside is importing and using gpx maps. which is not exactly user-friendly. Unfortunately, the aid for importing maps is out of date the menu no longer looks like that in the description. would not spoil an update on this topic.
reviews.reply:
Hello! Thank you for the feedback.
Could you please provide more details about the issue?
You can contact us at support@osmand.net.

reviews.review: Very nice and useable app 👍👍👍

Navigation instructions on small roads are only just usable. Lots of turns are not there IRL (road simply goes on) and other turns are not given. Requires lots of attention and checking the actual map.
A bloody great app!!

I really would like to like this, but it is just terrible. I like the idea of a gps app that does not store location data and that works fully offline, but when i look up a city thats only a half hour away and it has no idea what im talking about (this happens all the time) then its useless to me! the only way i've been able to get this to work right is to use specific cross streets. Cities, towns, and direct addresses do not work.
reviews.reply:
Hello! Thank you for the feedback.
We use OpenStreetMap as a source of data. This map is built by a community of volunteers, availability of data in some areas depends on the number of volunteers.

reviews.review: Fantastic app for hiking

Awesome app, but search needs to be a bit smarter. When I type the name of my city in "search by city", tens of the first results are streets that contains the name of the city and in the middle of those there is the actual city. Organic Maps seems to be better, you could learn from them :) But for anything else, this is a great use of osm data and philosophy.
great help
Good 👍
reviews.reply: Hello! Thank you for the feedback.

reviews.review: The map is exceptional

You can try to use step-by-step "Address search" in Menu – Search – Address search – Select city.
If you have any other questions please contact us at support@osmand.net

reviews.review: Thank you for this app! It's really helped me
Please help. Trying to take advantage of the Sale for OsmAnd+ that is ending in 3 days, but keeps giving me an error. I am running out of time. Love this map app!

So far the best navigation system I have met and I have had many. Fast, beatifull and easy to use. The only thing so far is with the house numbers. I have seen better systems. The arrows showing where some restorant is are poor. A "V" would be easier to read.
Why don't the maps tilt during navigation? I mean in isometric or 3d view
Very helpful and precise app. I already use it multiple years for all my hikings

The very serious issue with this app is the difficulty in exiting it. Once it's navigating it stays running on your phone and exiting it is criminally difficult. Just google how do I exit osmand and you will find teams of discussion about this issue and it seems the developer is unresponsive about it. They once had an exit button and then removed it because they thought of something "better' but on many phones it doesn't work. Install this app at your peril. For nav? Who knows it may be OK...
reviews.reply:
Hello, Gordon! Thank you for the feedback.
You need to stop navigation or track recording to exit OsmAnd. You can do it thru the notification center, because both these services show notifications, and both have a 'Stop' button, or you can stop in the app, where you previously start it.

reviews.review: Useless for route planing with stopovers (POIs and map points mixed). Awfull user interface.

reviews.review: Love the wealthy feature sets, but the rendering speed is a pain sometimes, if the Dev can solve the rendering speed issue then this app will be a 5/5 stars for sure. P.S. I think the rendering speed is more to to with database performance than the actual rasterization, so optimising the underlying database could do more help than reinvent the graphics engine which IMHO is very good already

Absolutely terrible navigation for cycling. It literally makes you cross a street leaving a cycle path for a narrow sidewalk instead. Even when adding a way point it still goes to a sidewalk. And adding a way point makes no sense, it doesn't work at all. The most un-intuitive app I've ever used. Looks like something from 2008. And still no traffic data!

You can try to change the "Driving style" option to "Prefer byways" in Menu – Navigation – Options.
If it doesn't help, please contact us at support@osmand.net with the coordinates of the route.

Somehow when it did connect on the new device it charged me again for the full app. Contacted customer service four times since then, and I've heard nothing. It's been six months. I don't care what any of the features of this map are, the developers are trash.

i am in Silang but i want to plan a route from Batangas City to Kamay Ni Hesus, Quezon City. I set the start and destination addresses but the program always starts in Silang where i am now. What am i doing wrong?
reviews.reply:
Hello, Brian!
Taping the "Start" button will launch navigation, which always starts from your current location, route calculation starts right after two points are added to navigation. You can try to use "Plan a route" to plan routes without location.
If you have any other questions please contact us at support@osmand.net

Other than that, does a good job finding routes. Let's you backup/restore config though, so it's not a recurring annoyance changing that.

description:
Skype keeps the world talking. Say “hello” with an instant message, voice or video call – all for free*.

Use Skype to send SMS messages to mobiles worldwide and with SMS Connect you can now also read and reply to your phone's SMS messages right from your computer. SMS connect will be released gradually.

• Video calls – Don’t just hear the cheers, see them! Get together with 1 or 24 of your friends and family on a HD video call. Watch everyone’s smiles and cries when you tell them “We’re engaged!!!" 
• Chat – Reach people instantly. Send messages to your friends, grab someone’s attention with @ mentions, or create a group chat to plan a family reunion. 
• SMS Connect - Read and reply to your phone's SMS messages in Skype on your PC or Mac.
• Share – Send photos and videos with your family and friends. Save shared photos and videos to your camera roll. Share your screen to make travel plans with friends or present designs to your team.
• Voice calls – Camera shy? Make voice calls to anyone in the world on Skype. You can also call mobile and landlines at low rates.
• Express yourself – Liven up conversations with emoticons, click on the “+” in chat to send a Giphy or images from the web, and annotate images with words, lines and more.

By downloading the Skype Preview, you’ll gain early access to our newest and coolest features. Of course, while you’re having fun, know that this app is a work in progress. We're hoping to get your vital feedback as we add new enhancements and features to Skype. Simply click the heart icon on the main screen and you will be able to send your comments to our team, helping us shape the future of Skype.

Skype is available on phones, tablets, PCs and Macs.

*Skype to Skype calls are free. Operator data charges may apply. We recommend using an unlimited data plan or WiFi connection.
summary: Talk to friends and family using voice, video, SMS or instant messages.
changelog:
We're listening to your feedback and working hard to improve Skype. 

What's new?
- Support for more languages in Translated Conversations i.e. Ukranian
- Support for Translated Conversations calls to mobile and landlines
- Bug fixes and improvements

Visit https://go.skype.com/whatsnew for more details.

description:
One of the world's most popular nature apps, iNaturalist helps you identify the plants and animals around you. Get connected with a community of over 400,000 scientists and naturalists who can help you learn more about nature! What's more, by recording and sharing your observations, you'll create research quality data for scientists working to better understand and protect nature. iNaturalist is a joint initiative by the California Academy of Sciences and the National Geographic Society.

KEY FEATURES
• Discover species new to you both near and far
• Record your own observations and share them with the community
• Receive suggestions and crowdsourced identifications of what you've seen 
• Discuss and help others identify what they've seen
• Follow projects comprised of smaller communities and fellow citizen scientists passionate about a particular place and/or species

For more info, check out http://www.inaturalist.org
summary: Observe and identify plants and animals with your friends
changelog:
* Fixed a bug with with "Nearby" projects tab
* New translations

reviews.review: Great way to identify flora and fauna
Very bad I photo a hamster but it said its a lion but it is a hamster 😡🐹
Amazing and addictive
A must have app for anyone who wants to identify literally anything on the planet.
But of a learning curve, but such an amazing resource for identification and connecting with professionals and amateurs alike
I like the App for what it is, but having seen the Apple version i can't help but be disappointed in what's offered on Android.
A great resource and educational tool!
I didn't know that this is not an automatic plant identifier. There are real people - so you have to wait. Now I know how to set my expectations.

Great app! Been using for a couple years. There's a bug in the app where the annotations aren't displaying properly- noticed this a couple of months ago. To ad annotations, I have to use the webpage on my browser. Please fix!
Gives very nice descriptions on many things all about nature. Birds,plants and so on.. I just downloaded the app,very cool app.
It doesn't have many wild plants in it.

Tried this app over 4 years and with 2 different phones now. In my experience, it has always been too slow or unresponsive to be properly usable, except for a quick upload or to open an observation link someone wants me to see instantly (which i can do with the website anyway, so why have the app.) The interface needs to be fixed so the app has a good reason to exist as a thing apart from Seek and the website. Until then, I'm going to continue using the iNat website on my phone's browser.
I love iNaturalist, but this app is buggy and still only rarely loads any photos of past records. For me that makes it not very usable.
Great for adding observations. Sometimes it's best to edit them or add detail from a computer later.

I really enjoy this app, but for its purpose it's very lacking. It's wonderful when the app recognizes the species exactly and it's likely true and maybe a knowledgeable member also confirms. However, it doesn't teach the average use much. For a lot of the species, quality photos that display key identifying features do not exist. We could benefit so much if the suggested species profile also stated certain key identifying features eg flower characteristics, leaf shape, bud arrangement, etc.

Please correct this issue. Thank you.

Easy to use. Love being able to contribute as a naturalist to document presence and numbers of local organisms. Love that experts confirm or suggest new species for my photo. A favorite app of mine! Especially excellent is the ease of taking pictures of an organism at the moment I am attempting to ID them. I love the AI photo comparisons and knowledge base of this site. Most of the time these comparisons and aid suggestions in relation to my photos are either accurate species matches or close
Its good, but it would be really helpful if you could upload video as well, as some animals move too fast for a photo. That way, you may also get their calls recorded.

Me encanta esta app. Agradezco que todo el conocimiento en tecnología se pueda usar para algo útil y positivo que contribuya a la naturaleza y a hacer conciencia sobre lo hermosa que es la naturaleza.

This is one of my favorite apps! I've already learned about a lot of new species in my area and elsewhere. I love that I can contribute to science while having fun on a photo safari. Gotta "catch" them all!

Very helpful

I love this app! It is so fun, and there are so many observations and organisms! There are some problems though. Randomly when I click on another person's observation, it restarts and brings me to my observations! And when I click on an observation within a person's profile, it brings me to the first one I looked at instead.
Fantástico.
Would love if this app had some of the features the web version has, but other than that it's a great app!!
way better than instagram.. love it

When you add a new entry, you're asked for a photo, and the you're asked, "What did you see?". There is no option to add a description if what you saw to answer this question. Instead, there is a search box so that you can find and select what you saw. If you don't already know, you cannot answer the question, and you' re now stuck. Since you're supposed to know beforehand what you see, that means this is merely a checklist and not an identification tool.
reviews.reply: Tapping "What did you see?" should display a list of organisms that look similar to your photo. You can also search by text and you should see an option to choose exactly the text you entered (we call this a "placeholder" ID). It's also fine to add a vague ID like "birds," or to not add an ID at all, and hope other people will add IDs to your obs.

reviews.review: Indispensable. I use this app mainly for bird ID after I've been out spotting. I've only recently started interacting with more features, the website and the Forum. Love it.

I've been a huge fan of this app for several years. The majority of the bad reviews are people who either don't know how to use the app's features correctly or misunderstand the purpose of the app. If you take the time to learn how to use it this app will revolutionize your relationship with the natural world. Highly recommend spending some time on the website to really grasp how it all works, then use the app on the go.
Best app
A hora do registro sempre fica errada quando faço upload de uma observação. As imagens ficam trocando de ordem sozinhas sem eu nem mexer nelas.

I love iNat, but this app is extremely laggy, I have a good phone, optic fiber internet, and yet it takes forever to do most of the stuff in the app. I tried clearing the cache but it didn't help at all.

The app was introduced when I attended an international conference. A representative from NatGeo introduced it to us. We had a tour in our location and started taking pictures to identify the name even the family and genus of plants and it was quite interesting. We can't recognize everything living thing in our planet and this app will surely help you in that field.
The best app for Naturalists throughout the world. But it takes a considerable time to open observations posted by other users of iNaturalist. Very slow. Loading.. loading.. & making it boring.

The app is terrible. The developers spend their time under the thumb of bad curators trying to chase down and remove users they don't like, meanwhile the app has terrible bugs. The android app crashes constantly. It uses HUGE space on your device. It is inconsistent. It uses tons of data along with drive space. The iPhone version is much worse, with fewer features. Clearly, this organization does not utilize development time well, or the app would work better. All valid reviews agree.

Generally decent app, occasional app hang, other bug. Species count only updated on next launch. App can't find Voice recording it just made. (:-( Would prefer more bug fixes listed in release notes to show submitting hang reports worth my time and effort (says freelance software tester).

Great app. Helps with ID-ing, useful for seeing what species are common in an area and what to look out for, etc. Other than how to put species in, there seems to be less info on how to use the app/site's other features, which is a minor point. Thanks creators, a wonderful app!

Best way to get something ID'd. Even if the auto-ID is wrong (common!), it gets checked by crowd sourcing. And the observations get used for science, awesome!

There is a minor bug with logging in but the support service, Mr. Tony, helped me out with it. The app in itself is AMAZING and I highly recommend it to every nature enthusiast. Things you can do on it - identify random insects, trees, fungi and birds - find native and endemic organisms around you - find nature lovers near you and see their observations - filled with high quality pics and research level identification points. - has no ADs or disturbances. - Easy to access and navigate

Stupid identification "fungi including lichens" or any identification like that then its research grade. No. Plants belong to plant kingdom. Bam i just identified all plants for you. Wonderful app that needs an update! Like a lot of people have said, the app is really struggling to load photos, which is particularly frustrating because the purpose of the app is to share ID photos. Hoping they update to fix this problem soon. That aside, the app is great. You can give permission for researchers and publishers to use your photos (and give you credit) which is very cool. Especially when your photo ends up as the main photo for an organism on the Wikipedia page!
